titles.title: To amend title 49, United States Code, to provide for limitations on the fees charged to passengers of air carriers.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Homeland Security.
Mr. Hudson moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5462.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 423 - 0 (Roll no. 505).

action.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.
Senate Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation discharged by Unanimous Consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 12/16/2014--Public Law. Revises aviation passenger security fee requirements to limit per round trip fees to $11.20.
